trans-unit.source: Represents a WQL SELECT data query.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.SelectQuery"></xref> class.
This is the default constructor.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.SelectQuery"></xref> class for the specified query or the specified class name.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The entire query or the class name to use in the query.
The parser in this class attempts to parse the string as a valid WQL SELECT query.
If the parser is unsuccessful, it assumes the string is a class name.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.SelectQuery"></xref> class for a schema query, optionally specifying a condition.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
`true` to indicate that this is a schema query; otherwise, `false`.
A `false` value is invalid in this constructor.
The condition to be applied to form the result set of classes.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.SelectQuery"></xref> class with the specified class name and condition.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The name of the class to select in the query.
The condition to be applied in the query.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.SelectQuery"></xref> class with the specified class name and condition, selecting only the specified properties.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The name of the class from which to select.
The condition to be applied to instances of the selected class.
An array of property names to be returned in the query results.
Builds the query string according to the current property values.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Gets or sets the class name to be selected from in the query.
Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object.
The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new class name.
A value for the **ClassName** property would replace the \<className> item in a SELECT query of the form "SELECT * FROM \<className> WHERE \<condition>".
Property Value
A string representing the name of the class in the query.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> value containing the name of the class in the query.
Creates a copy of the object.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The copied object.
Gets or sets the condition to be applied in the SELECT query.
Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object.
The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new condition.
A value for the **Condition** property would replace the \<condition> item in a SELECT query of the form "SELECT * FROM \<className> WHERE \<condition>".
Property Value
A string containing the condition to be applied in the SELECT query.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> value containing the condition to be applied to the SELECT query.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether this query is a schema query or an instances query.
Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object.
The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new query type.
Property Value
`true` if this query should be evaluated over the schema; `false` if the query should be evaluated over instances.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value indicating whether the query is a schema query.
Parses the query string and sets the property values accordingly.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The query string to be parsed.
Gets or sets the query in the <xref href="System.Management.SelectQuery"></xref> object, in string form.
Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object.
In addition, setting this property causes the other members of the object to be updated when the string is reparsed.
Property Value
A string representing the query.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> value containing the query.
Ggets or sets an array of property names to be selected in the query.
Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object.
The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new properties.
A value for the **SelectedProperties** property would replace the \<property> item in a SELECT query of the form "SELECT \<property> FROM \<className> WHERE \<condition>".
Property Value
A <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection> containing the names of the properties to be selected in the query.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection"></xref> containing the names of the properties to be selected in the query.
